context.scope: Research and documentation ONLY. No code changes.
context.problem: Need to pay contractors via credit card (for float), but Stripe blocks credit card funding of connected accounts. Current manual process is error-prone and doesn't scale.
constraints: Do NOT modify any source code
Do NOT create PRs or branches
Focus entirely on research, analysis, and documentation
All output goes into the output_file markdown document
key_questions: Can we use credit cards to pay contractors through Stripe?
What are all the legitimate approaches (Connect, Invoicing, intermediaries)?
What are the compliance/fraud concerns Stripe has?
What's the optimal solution given our constraints?

features.description: Understand and document current payment flow
features.deliverable: ## Current State section: How Joseph pays providers today, the manual steps, pain points, error risks

features.description: Research Stripe's policies on credit card funding
features.deliverable: ## Stripe Policy Analysis section: Why credit cards can't fund connected accounts, what Stripe is preventing, compliance context

## Options Analysis section with subsections for each approach: (A) Current Connect flow, (B) Provider-created invoices, (C) Mercury/Zelle intermediary, (D) Any other discovered options. Each with pros, cons, complexity, timeline.

features.description: Evaluate automation potential for each approach
features.deliverable: ## Automation Analysis section: What can be automated via APIs? What requires manual steps? Engineering effort estimates.

features.description: Document recommended approach with implementation roadmap
features.deliverable: ## Recommendation section: Clear winner, why it wins, detailed step-by-step implementation plan, timeline, risks, rollback plan
## Executive Summary at TOP of document: 2-3 paragraphs (60-second read), the problem, the solution, the ask
